definition: incoherent speech/to talk without rhyme or reason (idiom)
to tell to
dialect/language/speech
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
human relationship/order/coherence
next in sequence/second/the second (day, time etc)/secondary/vice-/sub-/infra-/inferior quality/substandard/order/sequence/hypo- (chemistry)/classifier for enumerated events: time

sentences.english: The man was asking, grammar wavering.
She raved out her bitter fate.
sentences.chinese: 她语无伦次地诉说她悲惨的命运。

sentences.english: Tom is right old, he often sputters his past.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆的确老了，他总是爱语无伦次地说他的往事。

sentences.english: Our father's face had reddened with rage and he began to sputter .
sentences.chinese: 我们的父亲气得涨红了脸，说话开始语无伦次。

sentences.english: He spluttered about where he had gone when I asked him.
sentences.chinese: 我问到他去哪里时，他有些语无伦次。

sentences.english: Some of them were still babbling incoherently, utterly panic-stricken.
sentences.chinese: 有许多人仍在语无伦次地唠叨着，完全一片恐慌。

sentences.english: Recently discovered that somebody likes speaking at a venture very much, even speaks incoherently .
sentences.chinese: 最近发现某某人很爱乱说话，甚至语无伦次。

sentences.english: He cowered in the corner, gibbering with terror.
sentences.chinese: 他蜷缩在角落里，吓得语无伦次。

to lisp/unclear articulation/inarticulate

definition: hands dance and feet trip (idiom); dancing and gesticulating for joy
babbling nonsense (idiom); crazy and unfounded ravings/double Dutch
out of one's wits (idiom)/distracted/stunned
to hum and haw (idiom); to mumble as if hiding sth/to speak and break off, then start again/to hold sth back
to hem and haw/to stall/to stammer/to mumble/to falter
not knowing what to do (idiom); at one's wits' end/embarrassed and at a complete loss
to get agitated/to panic
(idiom) to sidestep the question/to answer evasively
